content: You have entered a circular map. In the following questions, I will tell you what items are on the map, as well as your position and movements. You need to tell me the item you find after your movements. Please provide only the name of the item. Note that your answer should include only the name of the item and no other words.(Notice that for the same ring map, if the second path moves one step clockwise and one step counterclockwise from the first path, the endpoints reached in both cases should be the same.)

You have been given a circular path consisting of 10 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a gong. Moving in a clockwise direction from the gong, the elements on the path are a hockey puck, a gown, a vestment, a coyote, a front curtain, a projector, a castle, an Irish Setter, and a beaker. Starting from the vestment, you move around the ring by 10 steps in a clockwise direction. What will you find?

You have been given a circular path consisting of 10 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a gong. Moving in a clockwise direction from the gong, the elements on the path are a hockey puck, a gown, a vestment, a coyote, a front curtain, a projector, a castle, an Irish Setter, and a beaker. Starting from the vestment, you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 10 steps in a clockwise direction. What will you find?

"Since moving one step clockwise and one step counterclockwise from the same point results in being at the same position, the net effect of these two movements is that you are still at the vestment. Then, moving 10 steps clockwise from the vestment, you will find:\n\n\"beaker\""
